column3: Therefore, my brethren, when ye come together to eat, abide ye together.
Therefore do not thou shame the witnessing of our Lord Jesus Christ, neither me, his prisoner; but travail thou together in the gospel by the virtue of God;

Whether ye know not, that wicked men shall not wield the kingdom of God? Do not ye err; neither lechers, neither men that serve maumets [or idols], neither adulterers, neither lechers against kind, neither they that do lechery with men,
Therefore slay ye your members, which be on the earth, fornication, uncleanness, lechery, evil covetousness, and avarice, which is service of maumets [or simulacra];
For why God gave not to us the spirit of dread, but of virtue, and of love, and of soberness.
it suffereth all things, it believeth all things, it hopeth all things, it sustaineth all things.
And whoever [shall] pursue this rule, peace on them, and mercy, and on Israel of God.
Therefore whether ye eat, or drink, or do any other thing, do ye all things to the glory of God.
And ye were sometime these things; but ye be washed, but ye be hallowed, but ye be justified in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, and in the Spirit of our God.
For which cause also I suffer these things; but I am not confound-ed. For I know to whom I have believed, and I am certain that he is mighty to keep that is taken to my keeping, into that day.
For as oft as ye shall eat this bread, and drink this cup, ye shall tell [or show] the death of the Lord, till that he come [or till he come].
I do thankings to my God, to whom I serve from my progenitors [or my ancestors], in clean conscience, that without ceasing I have mind of thee in my prayers, night and day,
And as Jannes and Jambres against-stood Moses, so these against-stand the truth, men corrupt in understanding [or in soul], reproved about the faith.
And the works of the flesh be open, which be fornication, unclean-ness, unchastity, lechery,
Therefore neither he that planteth is anything, neither he that moisteth, but God that giveth increasing.
so that nothing fail to you in any grace, that abide the showing [or the revelation] of our Lord Jesus Christ;
For I will, that all men be as myself. But each man hath his proper gift of God; one thus, and another thus.
Pursue ye charity, love ye spiritual things, but more that ye prophesy.
And one and the same Spirit worketh all these things, parting to each by themselves as he will.
Each bear otherâ€™s charges, and so ye shall fulfill the law of Christ.
Walk ye, and stand ye in the faith; do ye manly, and be ye comforted in the Lord,
And, brethren, I praise you, that by all things ye be mindful of me; and as I betook to you my commandments, ye hold [or ye keep].
The word of Christ dwell in you plenteously, in all wisdom; and teach and admonish yourselves in psalms, and hymns, and spiritual songs, in grace singing in your hearts to the Lord.
Men, love ye your wives, and do not ye be bitter to them.
Keep thou the good [deposit, or thing], taken to thy keeping by the Holy Ghost, that dwelleth in us.
For he that soweth in his flesh, of the flesh he shall reap corruption; but he that soweth in the Spirit, of the Spirit he shall reap everlasting life.
Neither tempt we Christ, as some of them tempted, and perished of serpents.
it is not covetous, [or ambitious, or covetous of worships], it seeketh not those things that be his own [or her own], it is not stirred to wrath, it thinketh not evil,
Walk ye in wisdom to them that be withoutforth, again-buying time.
But those things that heathen men offer, they offer to devils, and not to God. But I will not, that ye be made fellows of fiends;
And upon all these things have ye charity, that is the bond of perfectness [or of perfection].
Now it is sought here among the dispensers, that a man be found true.
Know ye not, that ye be the temple of God, and the Spirit of God dwelleth in you?
Therefore ye, as the chosen of God, holy and loved, clothe [ye] you with the entrails of mercy, benignity, and meekness, temperance, patience;
Therefore I guess, that this thing is good for the present need; for it is good to [or for] a man to be so.
having the likeness of piety, but denying the virtue of it. And eschew thou these men.
But we gave no place to subjection, that the truth of the gospel should dwell with you.
And therefore he that speaketh in language [or in tongue], pray, that he expound [or interpret].
But now put ye away all things, wrath, indignation, malice, blasphemy and foul words of your mouth.
And they that be of Christ, have crucified their flesh with vices and covetings [or concupiscences].
that ye walk worthily to God pleasing by all things, and make fruit in all good work, and wax in the science of God,
for ye may not drink the cup of the Lord, and the cup of fiends; ye may not be partners of the board of the Lord, and of the board of fiends.
All thing, whatever thing ye do, in word or in deed, all things in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, doing thankings to God and to the Father by him [or doing thankings to God the Father by him].
He that is taught in word, commune he with him that teacheth him, in all goods [or in all good things].
nor I took it of man, nor learned, but by [the] revelation of Jesus Christ.
No man seek that thing that is his own, but that thing that is of another.
Of which I Paul am made minister [or a servant] by the dispensation of God, that is given to me in you, that I [ful] fill the word of God,
But eschew thou [or shun thou] unholy and vain speeches, for why those profit much to unfaithfulness,
And the word of wisdom is given to one by Spirit; to another the word of knowing, by the same Spirit;
For I betook to you at the beginning [or in the first] that thing which also I have received; that Christ was dead for our sins, by the scriptures;
See ye that no man deceive you by philosophy and vain fallacy, after the tradition of men, after the elements of the world, and not after Christ.
Which delivered us from the power of darknesses, and translated [us] into the kingdom of the Son of his loving,
But each man prove his own work, and so he shall have glory [only] in himself, and not in another.

And if any man guesseth himself to be seen foul on his virgin, that she is full waxen [or is well old], and so it behooveth to be done, do she that that she will [or what he will]; she sinneth not, if she be wedded, [+or s/he sinneth not, if s/he be wedded].
But what saith the scripture? Cast out the servant [or the handmaiden] and her son, for the son of the servant shall not be heir with the son of the free wife.
And if any man loveth God, this is known of him.
For this thing I say, that no man deceive you in height of words.
Most dear brother, do not thou pursue evil thing, but that that is good thing. He that doeth well, is of God; he that doeth evil, seeth not God.
nevertheless to us is one God, the Father, of whom be all things, and we in him; and one Lord Jesus Christ, by whom be all things, and we by him.
Neither do we fornication, as some of them did fornication, and three and twenty thousand were dead in one day.
Therefore no man despise him; but lead him forth in peace, that he come to me; for I abide him with brethren.
For no man may set another foundament, except [or besides] that that is set, which is Christ Jesus.
And when ye were dead in your guilts, and in the prepuce of your flesh, he quickened together you with him; forgiving to you all guilts [or all trespasses],
and clothe ye the new man, that is made new again into the knowing of God, after the image of him that made him;
But these things were done in figure of us, that we be not coveters of evil things, as they coveted.
Brethren, do not ye be made children in wits, but in malice be ye children; but in wits be ye perfect.
Therefore no man judge you in meat, or in drink, or in part of feast day, or of new moon, or of sabbaths,
Therefore I suffer [or I sustain] all things for the chosen, that also they get the health that is in Christ Jesus, with heavenly glory.
Women, be ye subject to your husbands, as it behooveth in the Lord.
And hereafter [or From hence-forth], no man be heavy to me; for I bear in my body the tokens, [or the wounds], of our Lord Jesus Christ.
For I am the least of the apostles, that am not worthy to be called apostle, for I pursued the church of God.

and when they had known the grace of God, that was given to me, James, and Peter [or Cephas], and John, which were seen to be the pillars, they gave the right hand of fellowship to me and to Barnabas, that we [preach] among the heathen, and they into the circumcision;
Whether ye know not, that your members be the temple of the Holy Ghost, that is in you, whom ye have of God, and ye be not your own?
but God showed to us by his Spirit. For why the Spirit searcheth all things, yea, the deep things of God.
Sons, obey ye to your father and mother by [or in] all things; for this is well pleasing in the Lord.
which have a reason of wisdom in vain religion [or in superstition] and meekness, and not to spare the body, not in any honour to the fulfilling of the flesh.
which yielded witnessing to thy charity, in the sight of the church; which thou leadest forth, and doest well-worthily to God.
And eschew thou [or shun] foolish questions, and without knowing, [or discipline], witting that those engender chidings.
If any man hungereth, eat he at home, that ye come not together into doom. And I shall dispose other things, when I come.
But pursue ye the better ghostly gifts. And yet I show to you a more excellent, [or worthy], way.
Be ye busy in prayer, and wake in it, in doing of thankings;
But a man shall not cover his head, for he is the image and glory of God; but a woman is the glory of man.
And the peace of Christ enjoy in your hearts, in which ye be called in one body, and be ye kind.
Yet all manner of fornication is heard among you, and such fornication, which is not among heathen men, so that some man have the wife of his father.

Temptation take not you, but manâ€™s temptation; for God is true, which shall not suffer you to be tempted above that that ye may; but he shall make with temptation also purveyance, that ye may suffer [or sustain].
Paul the apostle, not of men, nor by man, but by Jesus Christ, and God the Father, that raised him from death,
be we not made covetous of vain glory, stirring each other to wrath, or having envy each to other.
So a man guess, [or deem], us as ministers of Christ, and dispensers of the mysteries of God.
Wherefore, ye most dearworthy to me, flee ye from the worshipping of maumets [or idols].
Teach thou these things, witness-ing before God. Do not thou strive in words; for to nothing it is profitable, but to the subverting of men that hear.
For in all things ye be made rich in him, in each word, and in each knowing, [or science],
not with lechers of this world, nor with covetous men, nor raveners, nor with men serving to maumets [or to idols], else ye should have gone out of this world.
So the Lord ordained to them that tell the gospel, to live of the gospel.
and be all your things done in charity.
But then ye unknowing God, served to them that in kind were not gods.

But, brethren, I beseech you, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye all say the same thing, and that dissensions, [or schisms, or divisions, or discords], be not among you; but be ye perfect in the same wit, and in the same knowing.
And when ye were sometime aliened [or made strangers], and enemies by wit, in evil works, now he hath reconciled you
And flee thou [the] desires of youth, but follow thou rightwiseness, faith, charity, peace, with them that inwardly call [or that in-call] the Lord of a clean heart.
Therefore if ye have risen together with Christ, seek ye those things that be above, where Christ is sitting on the right half of God.
For when Christ shall appear, your life, then also ye shall appear with him in glory.
Whatever ye do, work ye of will as to the Lord and not to men;
traitors, over-thwart [or froward], swollen [or blown]with proud thoughts, blind, lovers of lusts more than of God,
and they had only an hearing, that he that pursued us sometime, preacheth now the faith, against which he fought sometime;
But see ye, lest peradventure this your leave [or license] be made hurting to sick men, [or frail].
But do we thankings to God, that gave to us victory by our Lord Jesus Christ.
Thou [a] servant art called, be it no charge to thee; but if thou mayest be made free, use it rather.
I wonder, that so soon ye be thus moved from him that called you into the grace of Christ, into another evangel [or another gospel];
Circumcision is nought, and prepuce is nought, but the keeping of the commandments of God.
Brethren, I say this thing, that flesh and blood may not wield the king-dom of God, neither corruption shall wield uncorruption [or incorruption].
As it is written, Abraham believed to God, and it was reckoned to him to rightwiseness.
But Christ again-bought us [or delivered us] from the curse of the law, and was made accursed for us; for it is written, Each man is cursed that hangeth in the tree;
For ye have heard my conver-sation sometime in the Jewry, that I pursued surpassingly, [or over-manner, or over-measure], the church of God, and fought against it.
Therefore he that joineth his virgin in matrimony, doeth well; and he that joineth not, doeth better.
But of him ye be in Christ Jesus, which is made of God to us wisdom, and rightwiseness, and holiness, and again-buying;
But the prick of death is sin; and the virtue of sin is the law.
The woman is bound to the law, as long time as her husband liveth; and if her husband is dead, she is delivered from the law of the husband, be she wedded to whom she will, only in the Lord.
which felled down from the truth, saying that the rising-again is now done, and they subverted [or turned upside-down] the faith of some men.
For in Jesus Christ neither circumcision is anything worth, neither prepuce, but the belief that worketh by charity [or but faith that worketh by charity].
But of the gatherings [or the collects]of money that be made into saints, as I have ordained in the churches of Galatia, so also do ye

If nevertheless ye dwell in the faith, founded, and stable, and unmoveable from the hope of the gospel that ye have heard, which is preached in all creature that is under heaven. Of which I, Paul, am made a minister,
But prove a man himself, and so eat he of that bread, and drink he of the cup.
Therefore, my dearworthy brethren, be ye steadfast, and unmoveable, being plenteous in work of the Lord, evermore witting that your travail is not idle in the Lord.
Therefore, brethren, I pray you, be ye followers of me, as I of Christ.

For the world, in wisdom of God, knew not God by wisdom, [or For why for in the wisdom of God, the world knew not God by wisdom], it pleased to God, by [the] folly of preaching, to make them safe that believed.
Do not ye be deceived; for evil speeches, [or false doctrine], destroy good conduct [or corrupt good virtues].
For God raised the Lord, and shall raise us by his virtue.
For which cause I admonish thee, that thou raise again the grace of God, that is in thee by the setting on [or the on-putting] of mine hands.
With price ye be bought; do not ye be made servants of men.
Neither grutch ye, as some of them grutched, and they perished of a destroyer [or of the waster].
For ye know, that when ye were heathen men, how ye were led going to dumb maumets [or dumb simulacra].
that delivered us, and called with his holy calling, not after our works, but by his purpose and grace, that is given [to us] in Christ Jesus before worldly times;
Do not ye lie, [or gab], together; despoil ye you from the old man with his deeds,

And the scripture seeing afar, that God justifieth the heathen of belief, [or Forsooth the scripture purveying, for God justifieth of faith heathen men], told before to Abraham, That in thee all the heathen [or all folks] shall be blessed.
I wrote to you in an epistle, that ye be not meddled, [or mingled, or commune not], with lechers,
But when it pleased him, that parted me from my motherâ€™s womb, and called by his grace,
We fools for Christ, but ye prudent in Christ; we sick, but ye strong; ye noble, but we unnoble.
Servants, obey ye by all things to fleshly lords, not serving at the eye, as pleasing to men, but in simpleness of heart, dreading the Lord [God].
And we have not received the spirit of this world, but the Spirit that is of God, that we know what things be given to us of God.
A true God [or Forsooth God is true], by whom ye be called into the fellowship of his Son Jesus Christ our Lord.
For, brethren, ye be called into freedom [or into liberty]; only give ye not freedom [or liberty] into occasion of flesh, but by charity of [the] Spirit serve ye together.
and diverse services there be, but it is all one Lord;
And so there is not now a servant, but a son; and if he is a son, he is an heir by God.
Busily keep [or Take care] to give thyself a proved, praiseable workman to God, without shame, rightly treating the word of truth.
it joyeth not on [or in] wicked-ness, but it joyeth together to [or with] truth;
I planted, Apollos moisted, but God gave increasing.
Of these they be that pierce houses, and lead women captives [or and lead little women captive], charged with sins, which be led with diverse desires,
Meat to the womb, and the womb to meats; and God shall destroy both this and that. And the body not to fornication, but to the Lord, and the Lord to the body.

But not in all men is knowing. For some men with conscience of idol, that is, they guess that the idol is some divine thing, till now eat as thing offered to idols; and their conscience is defouled, for it is sick.
But the scripture hath concluded all things under sin, that the promise of the faith of Jesus Christ were given to them that believe.

envies, manslayings, drunkennesses, unmeasurable eatings [or gluttonies], and things like to these, which I say to you before, as I have told to you before, for they that do such things, shall not have the kingdom of God.
And doing good fail we not; for in his time we shall reap, not failing.
For by the law I am dead to the law, [For by the law I am dead to the law, that I live to God;]
But it behooveth the servant of the Lord to chide not; but to be mild to all men, able to teach, patient,
For though I be absent in body, by spirit I am with you, joying and seeing your order and the firmness of your belief that is in Christ.
Fathers, do not ye provoke your sons to indignation, that they be not made feeble-hearted.
Therefore whoever eateth the bread, or drinketh the cup of the Lord unworthily, he shall be guilty of the body and of the blood of the Lord.
And truly they shall turn away the hearing from truth, but to fables they shall turn.
But if thou hast taken a wife, thou hast not sinned; and if a maiden is wedded, she sinned not; nevertheless such shall have tribulation of flesh. But I spare you.
But as it is written, That eye saw not, nor ear heard, neither it ascended into the heart of man, what things God arrayed [or made ready before] to them that love him;
Do not ye err, God is not scorned; for those things that a man soweth, those things he shall reap.
The Lord give mercy to the house of Onesiphorus, for oft he refreshed me, and shamed not my chain.
And I say to you in Christ, walk ye in Spirit, and ye shall not perform the desires of the flesh.
Therefore he that guesseth him, that he standeth, see he, that he fall not.
But I will that ye know, that Christ is [the] head of each man; but the head of the woman is the man; and the head of Christ is God.
But a mediator is not of one. But God is one.
Have thou the form of whole-some words, which thou heardest of me in faith and love in Christ Jesus.
Awake ye, just men, and do not ye do sin [or do not ye sin]; for some men have ignorance of God, but to reverence, that is, to your shame, I speak to you.
and men shall be loving them-selves, covetous, high of bearing, proud, blasphemers, not obedient to father and mother, unkind, cursed,
